result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick J. Carroll was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs are paid.  Bond applied.  Balance of bond to be returned to poster.

The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling, including AODA and psychological evaluations, if recommended.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to abide by all rules and conditions of the Agent.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  The Defendant is to have no contact with C.P. or any known drug dealers or users.  The Defendant must obtain and maintain full-time employment/educational programming or a combination of both as recommended.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis - surcharge is waived on Count 2.  After 2 years, if all conditions are met, and Agent recommends, the Court will approve early termination of probation.

timeConds.notes:
To begin sentence immediately.
Imposed - 45 days with work release for employment and treatment.
Stayed - 6 months - to be used by Agent with Court approval.
Credit is for revocation purposes.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

The Defendant is to undergo a mental health assessment and follow through with any recommended treatment/counseling. Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to abide by all rules and conditions of the Agent.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis, unless already provided.
